auto_merge.commit_message:
also move it to module state (since it certainly shouldn't be shared
across subinterpreters)

Fixes #6663.

I've assumed that we never want to block waiting for the cache.
Therefore, I've said that if the cache is contended we just abandon it.
If large numbers of exceptions are being thrown, this may mean it gets
populated very slowly. But I think that's OK.
auto_merge.commit_title: Make traceback frame cache thread safe (#6665)

repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
also move it to module state (since it certainly shouldn't be shared across subinterpreters)

Fixes #6663.

I've assumed that we never want to block waiting for the cache. Therefore, I've said that if the cache is contended we just abandon it. If large numbers of exceptions are being thrown, this may mean it gets populated very slowly. But I think that's OK.

comment_data.body:
This isn't a brilliant test, in that I couldn't actually get it to fail even without the patch.

I can see the issue in thread sanitizer without though, and can't see the issue in thread sanitizer with the patch. But I don't think it's time to add thread sanitizer to the test suite yet.
Just to make sure I correctly understand this: This can also be `atomic_store(0)` as well, right?
Oh right. Thanks for the explanation!

commit.message: Fix thread-safety issues with traceback cache

milestone.description:
* Remove code for Python 2 and Python < 3.8.
* Integrate better with Python 3.
* Improve support for the Limited API.
* Start supporting GIL-free Python 3.13.
* Support the Py3.13 `sys.monitoring` API.
* Support and use `am_send` for coroutines.

title: Make traceback frame cache thread safe
